intro: Cybianthus cuneifolius var. gracillimus, commonly known as the slenderleaf cybianthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open, sunny habitats. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to coastal climates with mild winters and warm, dry summers. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
